c74object.name: fl.correlate~
c74object.digest: Correlates two inputs (either real or complex).
c74object.description: The output length depends on the edges parameter, which sets the edge behaviour. Output length is M + N - 1 for linear correlation (M and N are the input lengths). For other edge behaviours the output length is the maximum of M and N. In complex mode pairs of inputs and outputs are used to represent complex values. If one of a pair of inputs is shorter than the other it is zero padded to match. Internal processing is FFT-based.

entry.name: 1. /max_length [instantiation int]
entry.description:
Sets the maximum processing length.
The processing length is M + N - 1 where M and N are the lengths of the two inputs.

entry.name: 2. /mode [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
Sets the type of input and output.
[0] - real [1] - complex

entry.name: 3. /edges [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
Sets the edge behaviour of the correlation process:
The basic operation is a linear one with output of the processing length.
For modes other than linear the output length is reduced to the maximum of M and N.
Excess from the linear operation is added back into the available length as specified.
linear - the output is the full processing length with no further processing.
circular - excess at the end is added back to the beginning of the output.
wrap - as circular mode but rotated such that wrapping occurs equally at both ends.
fold - as wrap but folding not wrapping at the edges (edge values are not repeated).
mirror - as fold but with repeated edge values.
[0] - linear [1] - circular [2] - wrap [3] - fold [4] - mirror
